title.narrative: ACEV: Förändrade maskulinitetsnormer genom involerat faderskap
ACEV: Involved Fatherhood by Transforming Masculinities

description.narrative:
ACEV har ansökt om finansiering 9,8 miljoner SEK (cirka 5,8 miljoner Turkiska Lira) från Sida för genomförandet av projektet "Förändrade maskulinitetsnormer genom involerat faderskap" i Turkiet under perioden 2020-2022.
Projektet syftar till att bidra till lika arbetsfördelning i barnomsorg och hushållssysslor [mellan män och kvinnor] genom att skapa förutsättningar för involverat faderskap. Att förändra fäders attityder och beteenden samt skapa förutsättningar för involverat faderskap anses nödvändigt för att möjligöra framsteg mot att uppnå målet.
Följande resultat väntas uppnås genom projektet:
- Resultat 1: Ökning av involverat faderskap hos målgrupper genom förändrade attityder och beteenden - Resultat 2: Förbättrad stödmiljö för involverat faderskap
Sida är enda givaren till projektet.

ACEV has applied to Sida for funding of 9,8 million SEK (circa 5,8 million TL) to carry out the project "Transforming Masculinities through Involved Fatherhood" in Turkey during the period of 2020-2022.
The project aims to contribute to equal division of labor in childcare and domestic chores through creating an enabling environment for involved fatherhood. Changing fathers’ attitudes and behaviors as well as creating a supportive environment for involved fatherhood are deemed necessary to progress for the fulfilment of this goal.
The following outcomes are set to be achieved through the project:
- Outcome 1: Increased involved fatherhood attitudes and behaviors in the targeted communities - Outcome 2: Enhanced supportive environment for involved fatherhood
Sida is the only donor of the project.

The project aims to contribute to equal division of labor in childcare and domestic chores through creating an enabling environment for involved fatherhood. Changing fathers’ attitudes and behaviors as well as creating a supportive environment for involved fatherhood are deemed necessary to progress for the fulfillment of this goal. Accordingly, the following outcomes are set to achieve throughout the project: Outcome 1: Increased involved fatherhood attitudes and behaviors in the targeted communities Outcome 2: Enhanced supportive environment for involved fatherhood In order to increase involved fatherhood attitudes and behaviors in the targeted communities, it is planned to realize activities not only for the implementation of the Father Support Program but also for the dissemination and sustainability of the results on the beneficiaries. On the other hand, the graduate fathers as well as the community they live in aims to be transformed through capacity building and awareness raising activities so as to create a supportive environment.

title.narrative: 13624- Agreement with ACEV for Involved Fatherhood by Transforming Masculinities Project
13624- Decision on Contribution for the ACEV Involved Fatherhood by Transforming Masculinities Project

description.narrative: The report provided is a midterm report, therefore none of the outcomes are expected to be achieved at this point, but the report provides an understanding of which activities could be realised and not, especially under the special challenges created by the pandemic. However, it is assessed by the NPO that it created a better understanding of the agreement requirements and the type of the information needed by Sida in terms of producing the reports by ACEV. It is observed that the project made a good start by implementing the approved workplan. However due to the start of the pandemic in March 2020 many of the project activities had to be cancelled, postponed or revised in terms of transforming the activities to online. Further assessment of the effects of the pandemic on the workplan and its implementation will be only available in the next reporting period which will cover the whole first year project implementation. On a general level it is assessed that ACEV is acting responsibly towards the beneficiaries in terms of keeping their commitment levels high to the project activities and ambitious towards finding alternative methods to engage with them on different modalities. It shall be further assessed in the next reporting period by the NPO whether there is an inclination of the partner towards activity-based reporting.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
